job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Flexible schedule, positive work environment
cons: Pay only once a month at the end of the month

review_title: Working at Fort Valley State University
job_title: Associate Professor in Fort Valley, GA
pros: A great place to start your academic career.
cons: Many of the processes and policies are antiquated.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Valley, GA
pros: FVSU provides growth opportunities and promotes success by providing learning opportunities for employees.
cons: Some procedures and processes are outdated and can be improved for efficiency and productivity.

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Valley, GA
pros: -Good work environment - flexible hours
cons: A lot of miscommunication and unorganized management

job_title: Lecturer (Business Administration) in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Lecturing at Fort Valley State University has been one of the highlights of my teaching career. I am convinced that HBCU's have a valuable contribution to make into the fabric of the United States.
cons: Challenging the culture and mindset of today's student that he/she does not need a textbook (in some format) so they can learn.

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Small community, lots of opportunities to get involved
cons: Unqualified persons run specific departments, and in those spaces, mentorship, or improvement is impossible. Lots of gatekeeping by persons who want the institution to be as it was when they graduated/attended in the 70s. Too many former students in place to affect substantive change for the good of students.

job_title: Research Assistant in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Laid back work environment and flexible hours
cons: No direction or motivation within the lab. Extremely poor management and work environment

job_title: Director in Macon, GA
pros: Networking and relationships—the staff is amazing.
cons: Elitism at its finest. Lack of accountability. Has no interest in doing what’s right.

job_title: Associate Professor in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Academic freedom is pretty much allowed.
cons: Unfortunately there are some departments that are being run like a high school and faculty are not being treated as professionals.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Fort Valley, GA
pros: The HBCU culture is great
cons: This school is very unorganized and set in their ways

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Valley, GA
pros: State benefits are great - insurance, retirement fund, the ability to take courses at state schools free of charge.
cons: FVSU excels at redistributing work when someone quits, retires, or is fired. They have had a list of "openings" for years that have gone unfilled, because the college doesn't want to spend the money. Forget about a raise, it isn't going to happen, no matter what promises are made. They will literally work the best employees to death - one had a heart attack, other have severe health problems - while letting slackers slide because they are related to someone in charge.

job_title: Assistant Registrar in Fort Valley, GA
pros: I was the assistant registrar for Fort Valley Fame Camp. I loved both the work the job required and the professor that was my both my coworker and boss.
cons: Unfortunately, it was only a very short summer gig that lasted a month each time, although I was lucky to get it 3 years in a row. Also unfortunate that, after my second employment with them, that professor retired and a replacement was brought. Afterwards, that replacement quit, too. Now I can no longer recommend it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Only a few employees truly care about their jobs. Little supervision. Small work environment so you get know everyone quickly.
cons: The rest are collecting checks and fail to realize how harmful their actions are to the university and its long-term future. Entirely too much drama. Do not provide enough professional development opportunities

review_title: There are great people who work there, but a lot of people are afraid of change.
job_title: Auxiliary Services in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Great schedule and benefits, worked with a great group of people, feel like I made a difference for the university
cons: Lots of people who have been there for years and don't know any different, no advancement or raises, antiquated systems and operations

review_title: It was a good experience, however no growth opportunity based on performance or talent existed.
job_title: Administrator in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Great President, however the senior management around the leader is not very good.
cons: Not a lot of growth opportunity within the organization in terms of senior management positions.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: The university is an exciting place to be! There are so many perks , I don't know where to begin.
cons: The only downside to working here is dealing with individuals who do not operate in a timely manner.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Atlanta, GA
pros: State benefits and holidays! Loved the students, it was wonderful getting to know the students.
cons: Management, very unprofessional. Lots of gossip. Some people had been there 10 yrs and never received a raise.

job_title: Security Officer in Musella, GA
pros: I love working with the students and the positive environment on campus.
cons: I didn't like when the students had to leave, when they went on break. I enjoyed the students on campus.

review_title: Average place to work if you do find any other place to work
job_title: Researcher in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Easy work schedule and no pressure
cons: No professional growth or chance for promotion

job_title: Senior Administrator in Fort Valley, GA
pros: Strong academic programs with visionary leadership
cons: Some faculty are are set in their ways lacking cretivity

job_title: Senior Admission Representative/Counselor in Stone Mountain, GA
pros: Traveling, Meeting new people daily, Teaching.
cons: Long work hours, standing and siting for long period of time.

job_title: Farm Worker in Fort Valley, GA
pros: I learned a lot working on a farm.

review_title: A full-time tenure track Chemistry Professor
